page.title: 19The Role of the Farmhouse
page.content: Nowadays not all original farmhouses are connected to the farming industry. Being usually large and built from very attractive Jersey granite they have become a much sought after residence for wealthy immigrants and locals. In many cases they have been extensively modernised and such luxury features as swimming pools and tennis courts added. Not only is the role of the farmhouse changing but also that of surrounding farm buildings. Granite barns have also become available because of the decreasing size of the average cow herd and the need for fewer farming implements owing to mechanisation. Thus they also are much desired for conversion into dwelling units. Examples of this can be found along La Rue De Bechet in St. John.
